content:
Diagnosis:
Limited stage small cell lung cancer, right lower lobe
DLL3 positive on immunohistochemistry

Previous treatment:
Completed 4 cycles concurrent chemoradiotherapy March-May 2024
Cisplatin/Etoposide with radical radiotherapy 45Gy in 30 fractions
Prophylactic cranial irradiation completed June 2024

Current medications:
Ondansetron 8mg prn
Lansoprazole 30mg daily

Current situation:
First follow-up post completion of treatment

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of concurrent chemoradiotherapy and prophylactic cranial irradiation for limited stage small cell lung cancer. She has made an excellent recovery from treatment with resolution of previous radiation pneumonitis. Her appetite and energy levels have significantly improved, and she has regained 3kg of weight. She denies any new respiratory symptoms or concerning features.

CT thorax performed last week shows excellent partial response with >50% reduction in the right lower lobe primary mass and resolution of previous mediastinal lymphadenopathy. Brain MRI shows no evidence of metastatic disease.

The plan is to continue regular surveillance with 3-monthly CT imaging. I have arranged follow up in clinic in 3 months with repeat CT chest. She understands to contact us sooner if any new symptoms develop.

cancer_timeline.value: Started concurrent cisplatin/etoposide chemotherapy with radical radiotherapy 45Gy in 30 fractions
CT thorax shows excellent partial response with >50% reduction in right lower lobe primary mass and resolution of mediastinal lymphadenopathy
Brain MRI shows no evidence of metastatic disease

patient_facts.value: Improved appetite and energy levels with 3kg weight gain
CT thorax shows >50% reduction in primary mass, resolution of lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: Limited stage small cell lung cancer showing excellent response to concurrent chemoradiotherapy with improving symptoms and radiological partial response
>50% reduction in right lower lobe primary mass and resolution of mediastinal lymphadenopathy
Review in clinic in 3 months with CT imaging
